hey guys welcome to the first kicking

this recipe is grandma fruit because
this is my grandma's recipe and I'm
going to show you two different sauces
the first sauce is how she likes to make

show you at the end it's a little bit

let's get started for this recipe we're
going to start by taking a beautiful
piece of pork belly I'm using about 1
pound of pork belly here and we want to
make sure its whole pork belly and not
slice we're going to save the slicing
for later start by bringing a pot of
water to boil and I'm using filtered
water here because I want to save this
soup stock for later in a different
recipe then when your waters come to a
boil place your pork belly and gently
lower the heat and then simmer covered
for 15 minutes while that's cooking
let's talk about sauces now my grandma's
favorite way to serve this is with a soy
sauce glaze now she really likes this
soy sauce glaze it kind of tastes like a
thick soy sauce so it has a thick
consistency but it's also slightly sweet
it's very good and as my grandma likes
to call out it is made in Taiwan which
means it's made with love and it tastes
good also as an added bonus it doesn't
have msg off to the side I'm going to
prepare some sliced green onions and
cilantro for garnish now back to the
pork belly
after 15 minutes turn off the heat and
let the pork belly's it covered in the
pan for an additional 25 minutes then
when the pork belly is done remove and
let cool for a few minutes before
cutting into thin slices

finally arrange the slices on a serving

a little bit concerned when people come

or you can alternatively make several of
these dipping sauce dishes so everybody
has their own to make the sauce it's
really easy I'm going to start with a
little serving dish like this add 1 TSP
of cane sugar 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
then I'm going to add in some green
onions some minced ginger chopped garlic
and cilantro mix that up really well and
set that aside for a few minutes just so
the sugar dissolves and you're good to
go I love the flavors of this sauce but
